args.name: domain
args.description: (Required) The domain of the certificate to look up. If no certificate is found with this name, an error will be returned.

args.name: statuses
args.description:
(Optional) A list of statuses on which to filter the returned list. Valid values are PENDING_VALIDATION, ISSUED,
INACTIVE, EXPIRED, VALIDATION_TIMED_OUT, REVOKED and FAILED. If no value is specified, only certificates in the ISSUED state
are returned.

args.name: types
args.description: (Optional) A list of types on which to filter the returned list. Valid values are AMAZON_ISSUED and IMPORTED.

args.name: most_recent
args.description: (Optional) If set to true, it sorts the certificates matched by previous criteria by the NotBefore field, returning only the most recent one. If set to false, it returns an error if more than one certificate is found. Defaults to false.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: Set to the ARN of the found certificate, suitable for referencing in other resources that support ACM certificates.

args.name: arn
args.description: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate authority.

args.name: id
args.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate authority.

args.name: certificate
args.description: Base64-encoded certificate authority (CA) certificate. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: certificate_chain
args.description: Base64-encoded certificate chain that includes any intermediate certificates and chains up to root on-premises certificate that you used to sign your private CA certificate. The chain does not include your private CA certificate. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: certificate_signing_request
args.description: The base64 PEM-encoded certificate signing request (CSR) for your private CA certificate.

args.name: not_after
args.description: Date and time after which the certificate authority is not valid. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: not_before
args.description: Date and time before which the certificate authority is not valid. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: revocation_configuration
args.description:
Nested attribute containing revocation configuration.
revocation_configuration.0.crl_configuration - Nested attribute containing configuration of the certificate revocation list (CRL), if any, maintained by the certificate authority.
revocation_configuration.0.crl_configuration.0.custom_cname - Name inserted into the certificate CRL Distribution Points extension that enables the use of an alias for the CRL distribution point.
revocation_configuration.0.crl_configuration.0.enabled - Boolean value that specifies whether certificate revocation lists (CRLs) are enabled.
revocation_configuration.0.crl_configuration.0.expiration_in_days - Number of days until a certificate expires.
revocation_configuration.0.crl_configuration.0.s3_bucket_name - Name of the S3 bucket that contains the CRL.

args.name: serial
args.description: Serial number of the certificate authority. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: status
args.description: Status of the certificate authority.

args.name: tags
args.description: Specifies a key-value map of user-defined tags that are attached to the certificate authority.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of the certificate authority.

args.name: arn
args.description: (Optional) The full ARN of the load balancer.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The unique name of the load balancer.

args.name: arn
args.description: (Optional) The arn of the listener. Required if load_balancer_arn and port is not set.

args.name: load_balancer_arn
args.description: (Optional) The arn of the load balander. Required if arn is not set.

args.name: port
args.description: (Optional) The port of the listener. Required if arn is not set.

args.name: arn
args.description: (Optional) The full ARN of the target group.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The unique name of the target group.

args.name: most_recent
args.description:
(Optional) If more than one result is returned, use the most
recent AMI.

args.name: executable_users
args.description:
(Optional) Limit search to users with explicit launch permission on
the image. Valid items are the numeric account ID or self.

args.name: filter
args.description:
(Optional) One or more name/value pairs to filter off of. There are
several valid keys, for a full reference, check out
describe-images in the AWS CLI reference.

args.name: owners
args.description:
(Optional) Limit search to specific AMI owners. Valid items are the numeric
account ID, amazon, or self.

args.name: name_regex
args.description:
(Optional) A regex string to apply to the AMI list returned
by AWS. This allows more advanced filtering not supported from the AWS API. This
filtering is done locally on what AWS returns, and could have a performance
impact if the result is large. It is recommended to combine this with other
options to narrow down the list AWS returns.

attrs.name: architecture
attrs.description: The OS architecture of the AMI (ie: i386 or x86_64).

attrs.name: block_device_mappings
attrs.description:
The block device mappings of the AMI.
block_device_mappings.#.device_name - The physical name of the device.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.delete_on_termination - true if the EBS volume
will be deleted on termination.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.encrypted - true if the EBS volume
is encrypted.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.iops - 0 if the EBS volume is
not a provisioned IOPS image, otherwise the supported IOPS count.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.snapshot_id - The ID of the snapshot.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.volume_size - The size of the volume, in GiB.
block_device_mappings.#.ebs.volume_type - The volume type.
block_device_mappings.#.no_device - Suppresses the specified device
included in the block device mapping of the AMI.
block_device_mappings.#.virtual_name - The virtual device name (for
instance stores).

attrs.name: creation_date
attrs.description: The date and time the image was created.

attrs.name: description
attrs.description:
The description of the AMI that was provided during image
creation.

attrs.name: hypervisor
attrs.description: The hypervisor type of the image.

attrs.name: image_id
attrs.description: The ID of the AMI. Should be the same as the resource id.

attrs.name: image_location
attrs.description: The location of the AMI.

attrs.name: image_owner_alias
attrs.description:
The AWS account alias (for example, amazon, self) or
the AWS account ID of the AMI owner.

attrs.name: image_type
attrs.description: The type of image.

attrs.name: kernel_id
attrs.description:
The kernel associated with the image, if any. Only applicable
for machine images.

attrs.name: name
attrs.description: The name of the AMI that was provided during image creation.

attrs.name: owner_id
attrs.description: The AWS account ID of the image owner.

attrs.name: platform
attrs.description: The value is Windows for Windows AMIs; otherwise blank.

attrs.name: product_codes
attrs.description:
Any product codes associated with the AMI.
product_codes.#.product_code_id - The product code.
product_codes.#.product_code_type - The type of product code.

attrs.name: public
attrs.description: true if the image has public launch permissions.

attrs.name: ramdisk_id
attrs.description:
The RAM disk associated with the image, if any. Only applicable
for machine images.

attrs.name: root_device_name
attrs.description: The device name of the root device.

attrs.name: root_device_type
attrs.description: The type of root device (ie: ebs or instance-store).

attrs.name: root_snapshot_id
attrs.description:
The snapshot id associated with the root device, if any
(only applies to ebs root devices).

attrs.name: sriov_net_support
attrs.description: Specifies whether enhanced networking is enabled.

attrs.name: state
attrs.description:
The current state of the AMI. If the state is available, the image
is successfully registered and can be used to launch an instance.

attrs.name: state_reason
attrs.description:
Describes a state change. Fields are UNSET if not available.
state_reason.code - The reason code for the state change.
state_reason.message - The message for the state change.

args.name: code
args.description: The reason code for the state change.

args.name: message
args.description: The message for the state change.

attrs.name: tags
attrs.description:
Any tags assigned to the image.
tags.#.key - The key name of the tag.
tags.#.value - The value of the tag.

attrs.name: virtualization_type
attrs.description:
The type of virtualization of the AMI (ie: hvm or
paravirtual).

args.name: executable_users
args.description:
(Optional) Limit search to users with explicit launch
permission on  the image. Valid items are the numeric account ID or self.

args.name: sort_ascending
args.description: (Defaults to false) Used to sort AMIs by creation time.

args.name: filter
args.description:
(Optional) One or more name/value pairs to filter off of. There
are several valid keys, for a full reference, check out
describe-images in the AWS CLI reference.

args.name: owners
args.description:
(Optional) Limit search to specific AMI owners. Valid items are
the numeric account ID, amazon, or self.

args.name: name_regex
args.description:
(Optional) A regex string to apply to the AMI list returned
by AWS. This allows more advanced filtering not supported from the AWS API.
This filtering is done locally on what AWS returns, and could have a performance
impact if the result is large. It is recommended to combine this with other
options to narrow down the list AWS returns.

args.name: id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the API Key to look up.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the API Key.

attrs.name: name
attrs.description: Set to the name of the API Key.

attrs.name: value
attrs.description: Set to the value of the API Key.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The REST API id that owns the resource. If no REST API is found, an error will be returned.

args.name: path
args.description: (Required) The full path of the resource.  If no path is found, an error will be returned.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the found Resource.

attrs.name: parent_id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the parent Resource.

attrs.name: path_part
attrs.description: Set to the path relative to the parent Resource.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the REST API to look up. If no REST API is found with this name, an error will be returned. 
If multiple REST APIs are found with this name, an error will be returned.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the found REST API.

attrs.name: root_resource_id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the API Gateway Resource on the found REST API where the route matches '/'.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the API Gateway VPC Link to look up. If no API Gateway VPC Link is found with this name, an error will be returned. 
If multiple API Gateway VPC Links are found with this name, an error will be returned.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Set to the ID of the found API Gateway VPC Link.

args.name: arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN to parse.

attrs.name: partition
attrs.description: The partition that the resource is in.

attrs.name: service
attrs.description: The service namespace that identifies the AWS product.

attrs.name: region
attrs.description:
The region the resource resides in.
Note that the ARNs for some resources do not require a region, so this component might be omitted.

attrs.name: account
attrs.description: The ID of the AWS account that owns the resource, without the hyphens.

attrs.name: resource
attrs.description:
The content of this part of the ARN varies by service.
It often includes an indicator of the type of resource—for example, an IAM user or Amazon RDS database —followed by a slash (/) or a colon (:), followed by the resource name itself.

args.name: name
args.description: Specify the exact name of the desired autoscaling group.

attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.

attrs.name: name
attrs.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group.

attrs.name: availability_zones
attrs.description: One or more Availability Zones for the group.

attrs.name: default_cool_down
attrs.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before another scaling activity can start.

attrs.name: desired_capacity
attrs.description: The desired size of the group.

attrs.name: health_check_grace_period
attrs.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling waits before checking the health status of an EC2 instance that has come into service.

attrs.name: health_check_type
attrs.description: The service to use for the health checks. The valid values are EC2 and ELB.

attrs.name: launch_configuration

attrs.name: load_balancers

attrs.name: placement_group
attrs.description: The name of the placement group into which to launch your instances, if any. For more information, see Placement Groups (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/placement-groups.html) in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

attrs.name: service_linked_role_arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service-linked role that the Auto Scaling group uses to call other AWS services on your behalf.

attrs.name: status
attrs.description: The current state of the group when DeleteAutoScalingGroup is in progress.

attrs.name: target_group_arns
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the target groups for your load balancer.

attrs.name: termination_policies
attrs.description: The termination policies for the group.

attrs.name: vpc_zone_identifier

args.name: filter
args.description:
(Optional) A filter used to scope the list e.g. by tags. See related docs.
name - (Required) The name of the filter. The valid values are: auto-scaling-group, key, value, and propagate-at-launch.
values - (Required) The value of the filter.

The part of the AZ name that appears after the region name,

"unavailable". By default the list includes a complete set of Availability Zones

attrs.description: A short, human-readable string to provide additional details about the current status of the compute environment.

attrs.description: The state of the compute environment (for example, ENABLED or DISABLED). If the state is ENABLED, then the compute environment accepts jobs from a queue and can scale out automatically based on queues.

A short, human-readable string to provide additional details about the current status

attrs.name: state
attrs.description: Describes the ability of the queue to accept new jobs (for example, ENABLED or DISABLED).

attrs.name: priority
attrs.description:
The priority of the job queue. Job queues with a higher priority are evaluated first when
  associated with the same compute environment.

attrs.name: compute_environment_order
attrs.description:
The compute environments that are attached to the job queue and the order in
  which job placement is preferred. Compute environments are selected for job placement in ascending order.
compute_environment_order.#.order - The order of the compute environment.
compute_environment_order.#.compute_environment - The ARN of the compute environment.

attrs.description:
The list of cluster certificates.
cluster_certificates.0.cluster_certificate - The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
cluster_certificates.0.cluster_csr - The certificate signing request (CSR). Available only in UNINITIALIZED state.
cluster_certificates.0.aws_hardware_certificate - The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
cluster_certificates.0.hsm_certificate - The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
cluster_certificates.0.manufacturer_hardware_certificate - The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware manufacturer.
The number of available cluster certificates may vary depending on state of the cluster.

args.name: snapshot_type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of snapshots to be returned. If you don't specify a SnapshotType
value, then both automated and manual DB cluster snapshots are returned. Shared and public DB Cluster Snapshots are not
included in the returned results by default. Possible values are, automated, manual, shared and public.

args.name: include_shared
args.description:
(Optional) Set this value to true to include shared manual DB Cluster Snapshots from other
AWS accounts that this AWS account has been given permission to copy or restore, otherwise set this value to false.
The default is false.

args.name: include_public
args.description:
(Optional) Set this value to true to include manual DB Cluster Snapshots that are public and can be
copied or restored by any AWS account, otherwise set this value to false. The default is false.

(Optional) The type of snapshots to be returned. If you don't specify a SnapshotType
value, then both automated and manual snapshots are returned. Shared and public DB snapshots are not
included in the returned results by default. Possible values are, automated, manual, shared and public.

args.name: include_shared
args.description:
(Optional) Set this value to true to include shared manual DB snapshots from other
AWS accounts that this AWS account has been given permission to copy or restore, otherwise set this value to false.
The default is false.

args.name: include_public
args.description:
(Optional) Set this value to true to include manual DB snapshots that are public and can be
copied or restored by any AWS account, otherwise set this value to false. The default is false.

args.name: override_json
args.description:
(Optional)  An IAM policy document to import and override the
current policy document.  Statements with non-blank sids in the override
document will overwrite statements with the same sid in the current document.
Statements without an sid cannot be overwritten.

args.name: statement
args.description:
(Optional)  A nested configuration block (described below)
configuring one statement to be included in the policy document.

args.name: sid
args.description: (Optional)  An ID for the policy statement.

args.name: effect
args.description:
(Optional)  Either "Allow" or "Deny", to specify whether this
statement allows or denies the given actions. The default is "Allow".

args.name: actions
args.description:
(Optional)  A list of actions that this statement either allows
or denies. For example, ["ec2:RunInstances", "s3:*"].

args.name: not_actions
args.description:
(Optional)  A list of actions that this statement does not
apply to. Used to apply a policy statement to all actions except those
listed.

args.name: resources
args.description:
(Optional)  A list of resource ARNs that this statement applies
to. This is required by AWS if used for an IAM policy.

args.name: not_resources
args.description:
(Optional)  A list of resource ARNs that this statement
does not apply to. Used to apply a policy statement to all resources
except those listed.

args.name: principals
args.description:
(Optional)  A nested configuration block (described below)
specifying a resource (or resource pattern) to which this statement applies.

args.name: not_principals
args.description:
(Optional)  Like principals except gives resources that
the statement does not apply to.

args.name: condition
args.description:
(Optional)  A nested configuration block (described below)
that defines a further, possibly-service-specific condition that constrains
whether this statement applies.

args.name: test
args.description:
(Required) The name of the
IAM condition type
to evaluate.

args.name: variable
args.description:
(Required) The name of a
Context Variable
to apply the condition to. Context variables may either be standard AWS
variables starting with aws:, or servicespecific variables prefixed with
the service name.

args.name: values
args.description:
(Required) The values to evaluate the condition against. If multiple
values are provided, the condition matches if at least one of them applies.
(That is, the tests are combined with the "OR" boolean operation.)

args.name: version
args.description: (Optional)  IAM policy document version. Valid values: 2008-10-17, 2012-10-17. Defaults to 2012-10-17. For more information, see the AWS IAM User Guide.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The type of principal. For AWS accounts this is "AWS".

args.name: identifiers
args.description:
(Required) List of identifiers for principals. When type
is "AWS", these are IAM user or role ARNs.

attrs.name: json
attrs.description: The above arguments serialized as a standard JSON policy document.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The friendly IAM role name to match.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The friendly IAM role name to match.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the role.

attrs.name: assume_role_policy
attrs.description: The policy document associated with the role.

attrs.name: path
attrs.description: The path to the role.

attrs.name: permissions_boundary
attrs.description: The ARN of the policy that is used to set the permissions boundary for the role.

attrs.name: unique_id
attrs.description: The stable and unique string identifying the role.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: : The globally unique identifier for the key

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: : The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key

attrs.name: aws_account_id
attrs.description: : The twelvedigit account ID of the AWS account that owns the key

attrs.name: creation_date
attrs.description: : The date and time when the key was created

attrs.name: deletion_date
attrs.description: : The date and time after which AWS KMS deletes the key. This value is present only when key_state is PendingDeletion, otherwise this value is 0

attrs.name: description
attrs.description: : The description of the key.

attrs.name: enabled
attrs.description: : Specifies whether the key is enabled. When key_state is Enabled this value is true, otherwise it is false

attrs.name: expiration_model
attrs.description: : Specifies whether the Key's key material expires. This value is present only when origin is EXTERNAL, otherwise this value is empty

attrs.name: key_manager
attrs.description: : The key's manager

attrs.name: key_state
attrs.description: : The state of the key

attrs.name: key_usage
attrs.description: : Currently the only allowed value is ENCRYPT_DECRYPT

attrs.name: origin
attrs.description: : When this value is AWS_KMS, AWS KMS created the key material. When this value is EXTERNAL, the key material was imported from your existing key management infrastructure or the CMK lacks key material

attrs.name: valid_to
attrs.description: : The time at which the imported key material expires. This value is present only when origin is EXTERNAL and whose expiration_model is KEY_MATERIAL_EXPIRES, otherwise this value is 0

args.name: domain_name
args.description:
Creating an amazon issued certificate
  (Required) A domain name for which the certificate should be issued
subject_alternative_names - (Optional) A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate
validation_method - (Required) Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

args.name: domain_name
args.description: (Required) A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

args.name: subject_alternative_names
args.description: (Optional) A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate

args.name: validation_method
args.description: (Required) Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

args.name: private_key
args.description:
Importing an existing certificate
  (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted private key
certificate_body - (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted public key
certificate_chain - (Optional) The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

args.name: private_key
args.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

args.name: certificate_body
args.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted public key

args.name: certificate_chain
args.description: (Optional) The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The ARN of the certificate

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The ARN of the certificate

attrs.name: domain_name
attrs.description: The domain name for which the certificate is issued

attrs.name: domain_validation_options
attrs.description: A list of attributes to feed into other resources to complete certificate validation. Can have more than one element, e.g. if SANs are defined. Only set if DNS-validation was used.

attrs.name: validation_emails
attrs.description: A list of addresses that received a validation E-Mail. Only set if EMAIL-validation was used.

args.name: certificate_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the certificate that is being validated.

args.name: validation_record_fqdns
args.description: (Optional) List of FQDNs that implement the validation. Only valid for DNS validation method ACM certificates. If this is set, the resource can implement additional sanity checks and has an explicit dependency on the resource that is implementing the validation

args.name: create
args.description: (Default 45m) How long to wait for a certificate to be issued.

args.name: certificate_authority_configuration
args.description: (Required) Nested argument containing algorithms and certificate subject information. Defined below.

args.name: key_algorithm
args.description: (Required) Type of the public key algorithm and size, in bits, of the key pair that your key pair creates when it issues a certificate. Valid values can be found in the ACM PCA Documentation.

args.name: signing_algorithm
args.description: (Required) Name of the algorithm your private CA uses to sign certificate requests. Valid values can be found in the ACM PCA Documentation.

args.name: subject
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that contains X.500 distinguished name information. At least one nested attribute must be specified.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Whether the certificate authority is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

args.name: revocation_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument containing revocation configuration. Defined below.

args.name: crl_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument containing configuration of the certificate revocation list (CRL), if any, maintained by the certificate authority. Defined below.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) Specifies a key-value map of user-defined tags that are attached to the certificate authority.

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) The type of the certificate authority. Currently, this must be SUBORDINATE.

args.name: common_name
args.description: (Optional) Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) associated with the certificate subject.

args.name: country
args.description: (Optional) Two digit code that specifies the country in which the certificate subject located.

args.name: distinguished_name_qualifier
args.description: (Optional) Disambiguating information for the certificate subject.

args.name: generation_qualifier
args.description: (Optional) Typically a qualifier appended to the name of an individual. Examples include Jr. for junior, Sr. for senior, and III for third.

args.name: given_name
args.description: (Optional) First name.

args.name: initials
args.description: (Optional) Concatenation that typically contains the first letter of the given_name, the first letter of the middle name if one exists, and the first letter of the surname.

args.name: locality
args.description: (Optional) The locality (such as a city or town) in which the certificate subject is located.

args.name: organization
args.description: (Optional) Legal name of the organization with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

args.name: organizational_unit
args.description: (Optional) A subdivision or unit of the organization (such as sales or finance) with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

args.name: pseudonym
args.description: (Optional) Typically a shortened version of a longer given_name. For example, Jonathan is often shortened to John. Elizabeth is often shortened to Beth, Liz, or Eliza.

args.name: state
args.description: (Optional) State in which the subject of the certificate is located.

args.name: surname
args.description: (Optional) Family name. In the US and the UK for example, the surname of an individual is ordered last. In Asian cultures the surname is typically ordered first.

args.name: title
args.description: (Optional) A title such as Mr. or Ms. which is pre-pended to the name to refer formally to the certificate subject.

args.name: custom_cname
args.description: (Optional) Name inserted into the certificate CRL Distribution Points extension that enables the use of an alias for the CRL distribution point. Use this value if you don't want the name of your S3 bucket to be public.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Boolean value that specifies whether certificate revocation lists (CRLs) are enabled. Defaults to false.

args.name: expiration_in_days
args.description: (Required) Number of days until a certificate expires. Must be between 1 and 5000.

args.name: s3_bucket_name
args.description: (Optional) Name of the S3 bucket that contains the CRL. If you do not provide a value for the custom_cname argument, the name of your S3 bucket is placed into the CRL Distribution Points extension of the issued certificate. You must specify a bucket policy that allows ACM PCA to write the CRL to your bucket.

args.name: id
args.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate authority.

args.name: create
args.description: (Default 1m) How long to wait for a certificate authority to be created.

args.name: arn
args.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate authority.

args.name: certificate
args.description: Base64-encoded certificate authority (CA) certificate. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: certificate_chain
args.description: Base64-encoded certificate chain that includes any intermediate certificates and chains up to root on-premises certificate that you used to sign your private CA certificate. The chain does not include your private CA certificate. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: certificate_signing_request
args.description: The base64 PEM-encoded certificate signing request (CSR) for your private CA certificate.

args.name: not_after
args.description: Date and time after which the certificate authority is not valid. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: not_before
args.description: Date and time before which the certificate authority is not valid. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: serial
args.description: Serial number of the certificate authority. Only available after the certificate authority certificate has been imported.

args.name: status
args.description: Status of the certificate authority.

args.name: cloudwatch_role_arn
args.description:
(Optional) The ARN of an IAM role for CloudWatch (to allow logging & monitoring).
  See more in AWS Docs.
  Logging & monitoring can be enabled/disabled and otherwise tuned on the API Gateway Stage level.

args.name: throttle_settings
args.description: Account-Level throttle settings. See exported fields below.

args.name: burst_limit
args.description: The absolute maximum number of times API Gateway allows the API to be called per second (RPS).

args.name: rate_limit
args.description: The number of times API Gateway allows the API to be called per second on average (RPS).

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the API key

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The API key description. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the API key can be used by callers. Defaults to true.

args.name: value
args.description: (Optional) The value of the API key. If not specified, it will be automatically generated by AWS on creation.

args.name: stage_key
args.description: (Optional) A list of stage keys associated with the API key - see below

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated REST API.

args.name: stage_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the API Gateway stage.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the API key

args.name: created_date
args.description: The creation date of the API key

args.name: last_updated_date
args.description: The last update date of the API key

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the API key

args.name: authorizer_uri
args.description:
(Optional, required for type TOKEN/REQUEST) The authorizer's Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
  This must be a well-formed Lambda function URI in the form of arn:aws:apigateway:{region}:lambda:path/{service_api},
  e.g. arn:aws:apigateway:us-west-2:lambda:path/2015-03-31/functions/arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:012345678912:function:my-function/invocations

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the authorizer

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated REST API

args.name: identity_source
args.description:
(Optional) The source of the identity in an incoming request.
  Defaults to method.request.header.Authorization. For REQUEST type, this may be a comma-separated list of values, including headers, query string parameters and stage variables - e.g. "method.request.header.SomeHeaderName,method.request.querystring.SomeQueryStringName,stageVariables.SomeStageVariableName"

args.name: type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of the authorizer. Possible values are TOKEN for a Lambda function using a single authorization token submitted in a custom header, REQUEST for a Lambda function using incoming request parameters, or COGNITO_USER_POOLS for using an Amazon Cognito user pool.
  Defaults to TOKEN.

args.name: authorizer_credentials
args.description:
(Optional) The credentials required for the authorizer.
  To specify an IAM Role for API Gateway to assume, use the IAM Role ARN.

args.name: authorizer_result_ttl_in_seconds
args.description:
(Optional) The TTL of cached authorizer results in seconds.
  Defaults to 300.

args.name: identity_validation_expression
args.description:
(Optional) A validation expression for the incoming identity.
  For TOKEN type, this value should be a regular expression. The incoming token from the client is matched
  against this expression, and will proceed if the token matches. If the token doesn't match,
  the client receives a 401 Unauthorized response.

args.name: provider_arns
args.description:
(Optional, required for type COGNITO_USER_POOLS) A list of the Amazon Cognito user pool ARNs.
  Each element is of this format: arn:aws:cognito-idp:{region}:{account_id}:userpool/{user_pool_id}.

args.name: domain_name
args.description: (Required) The already-registered domain name to connect the API to.

args.name: api_id
args.description: (Required) The id of the API to connect.

args.name: stage_name
args.description: (Optional) The name of a specific deployment stage to expose at the given path. If omitted, callers may select any stage by including its name as a path element after the base path.

args.name: base_path
args.description: (Optional) Path segment that must be prepended to the path when accessing the API via this mapping. If omitted, the API is exposed at the root of the given domain.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the client certificate.

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the client certificate.

args.name: created_date
args.description: The date when the client certificate was created.

args.name: expiration_date
args.description: The date when the client certificate will expire.

args.name: pem_encoded_certificate
args.description: The PEM-encoded public key of the client certificate.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated REST API

args.name: stage_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the stage. If the specified stage already exists, it will be updated to point to the new deployment. If the stage does not exist, a new one will be created and point to this deployment. Use "" to point at the default stage.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the deployment

args.name: stage_description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the stage

args.name: variables
args.description: (Optional) A map that defines variables for the stage

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the deployment

args.name: invoke_url
args.description:
The URL to invoke the API pointing to the stage,
e.g. https://z4675bid1j.execute-api.eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/prod

args.name: execution_arn
args.description:
The execution ARN to be used in lambda_permission's source_arn
when allowing API Gateway to invoke a Lambda function,
e.g. arn:aws:execute-api:eu-west-2:123456789012:z4675bid1j/prod

args.name: created_date
args.description: The creation date of the deployment

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) The location of the targeted API entity of the to-be-created documentation part. See below.

args.name: properties
args.description: (Required) A content map of API-specific key-value pairs describing the targeted API entity. The map must be encoded as a JSON string, e.g., "{ "description": "The API does ..." }". Only Swagger-compliant key-value pairs can be exported and, hence, published.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated Rest API

args.name: method
args.description: (Optional) The HTTP verb of a method. The default value is * for any method.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the targeted API entity.

args.name: path
args.description: (Optional) The URL path of the target. The default value is / for the root resource.

args.name: status_code
args.description: (Optional) The HTTP status code of a response. The default value is * for any status code.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The type of API entity to which the documentation content applies. e.g. API, METHOD or REQUEST_BODY

args.name: id
args.description: The unique ID of the Documentation Part

args.name: version
args.description: (Required) The version identifier of the API documentation snapshot.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated Rest API

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the API documentation version.

args.name: domain_name
args.description: (Required) The fully-qualified domain name to register

args.name: endpoint_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Configuration block defining API endpoint information including type. Defined below.

args.name: types
args.description: (Required) A list of endpoint types. This resource currently only supports managing a single value. Valid values: EDGE or REGIONAL. If unspecified, defaults to EDGE. Must be declared as REGIONAL in non-Commercial partitions. Refer to the documentation for more information on the difference between edge-optimized and regional APIs.

args.name: certificate_arn
args.description: (Optional) The ARN for an AWS-managed certificate. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source. Used when an edge-optimized domain name is desired. Conflicts with certificate_name, certificate_body, certificate_chain, certificate_private_key, regional_certificate_arn, and regional_certificate_name.

args.name: regional_certificate_arn
args.description: (Optional) The ARN for an AWS-managed certificate. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source. Used when a regional domain name is desired. Conflicts with certificate_arn, certificate_name, certificate_body, certificate_chain, and certificate_private_key.

args.name: certificate_name
args.description:
(Optional) The unique name to use when registering this
certificate as an IAM server certificate. Conflicts with certificate_arn, regional_certificate_arn, and
regional_certificate_name. Required if certificate_arn is not set.

args.name: certificate_body
args.description:
(Optional) The certificate issued for the domain name
being registered, in PEM format. Only valid for EDGE endpoint configuration type. Conflicts with certificate_arn, regional_certificate_arn, and
regional_certificate_name.

args.name: certificate_chain
args.description:
(Optional) The certificate for the CA that issued the
certificate, along with any intermediate CA certificates required to
create an unbroken chain to a certificate trusted by the intended API clients. Only valid for EDGE endpoint configuration type. Conflicts with certificate_arn,
regional_certificate_arn, and regional_certificate_name.

args.name: certificate_private_key
args.description:
(Optional) The private key associated with the
domain certificate given in certificate_body. Only valid for EDGE endpoint configuration type. Conflicts with certificate_arn, regional_certificate_arn, and regional_certificate_name.

args.name: regional_certificate_name
args.description:
(Optional) The user-friendly name of the certificate that will be used by regional endpoint for this domain name. Conflicts with certificate_arn, certificate_name, certificate_body, certificate_chain, and
certificate_private_key.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The internal id assigned to this domain name by API Gateway.

attrs.name: certificate_upload_date
attrs.description: The upload date associated with the domain certificate.

attrs.name: cloudfront_domain_name
attrs.description:
The hostname created by Cloudfront to represent
the distribution that implements this domain name mapping.

attrs.name: cloudfront_zone_id
attrs.description:
For convenience, the hosted zone ID (Z2FDTNDATAQYW2)
that can be used to create a Route53 alias record for the distribution.

attrs.name: regional_domain_name
attrs.description: The hostname for the custom domain's regional endpoint.

attrs.name: regional_zone_id
attrs.description: The hosted zone ID that can be used to create a Route53 alias record for the regional endpoint.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The string identifier of the associated REST API.

args.name: response_type
args.description: (Required) The response type of the associated GatewayResponse.

args.name: status_code
args.description: (Optional) The HTTP status code of the Gateway Response.

args.name: response_parameters
args.description: (Optional) A map specifying the templates used to transform the response body.

args.name: response_templates
args.description: (Optional) A map specifying the parameters (paths, query strings and headers) of the Gateway Response.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated REST API.

args.name: resource_id
args.description: (Required) The API resource ID.

args.name: http_method
args.description:
(Required) The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION, ANY)
when calling the associated resource.

args.name: integration_http_method
args.description:
(Optional) The integration HTTP method
(GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION) specifying how API Gateway will interact with the back end.
Required if type is AWS, AWS_PROXY, HTTP or HTTP_PROXY.
Not all methods are compatible with all AWS integrations.
e.g. Lambda function can only be invoked via POST.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The integration input's type. Valid values are HTTP (for HTTP backends), MOCK (not calling any real backend), AWS (for AWS services), AWS_PROXY (for Lambda proxy integration) and HTTP_PROXY (for HTTP proxy integration). An HTTP or HTTP_PROXY integration with a connection_type of VPC_LINK is referred to as a private integration and uses a VpcLink to connect API Gateway to a network load balancer of a VPC.

args.name: connection_type
args.description: (Optional) The integration input's connectionType. Valid values are INTERNET (default for connections through the public routable internet), and VPC_LINK (for private connections between API Gateway and a network load balancer in a VPC).

args.name: connection_id
args.description: (Optional) The id of the VpcLink used for the integration. Required if connection_type is VPC_LINK

args.name: uri
args.description:
(Optional) The input's URI (HTTP, AWS). Required if type is HTTP or AWS.
For HTTP integrations, the URI must be a fully formed, encoded HTTP(S) URL according to the RFC-3986 specification . For AWS integrations, the URI should be of the form arn:aws:apigateway:{region}:{subdomain.service|service}:{path|action}/{service_api}. region, subdomain and service are used to determine the right endpoint.
e.g. arn:aws:apigateway:eu-west-1:lambda:path/2015-03-31/functions/arn:aws:lambda:eu-west-1:012345678901:function:my-func/invocations

args.name: credentials
args.description: (Optional) The credentials required for the integration. For AWS integrations, 2 options are available. To specify an IAM Role for Amazon API Gateway to assume, use the role's ARN. To require that the caller's identity be passed through from the request, specify the string arn:aws:iam::\*:user/\*.

args.name: request_templates
args.description: (Optional) A map of the integration's request templates.

args.name: request_parameters
args.description:
(Optional) A map of request query string parameters and headers that should be passed to the backend responder.
For example: request_parameters = { "integration.request.header.X-Some-Other-Header" = "method.request.header.X-Some-Header" }

args.name: passthrough_behavior
args.description: (Optional) The integration passthrough behavior (WHEN_NO_MATCH, WHEN_NO_TEMPLATES, NEVER).  Required if request_templates is used.

args.name: cache_key_parameters
args.description: (Optional) A list of cache key parameters for the integration.

args.name: cache_namespace
args.description: (Optional) The integration's cache namespace.

args.name: request_parameters_in_json
args.description: Deprecated, use request_parameters instead.

args.name: content_handling
args.description: (Optional) Specifies how to handle request payload content type conversions. Supported values are CONVERT_TO_BINARY and CONVERT_TO_TEXT. If this property is not defined, the request payload will be passed through from the method request to integration request without modification, provided that the passthroughBehaviors is configured to support payload pass-through.

args.name: timeout_milliseconds
args.description: (Optional) Custom timeout between 50 and 29,000 milliseconds. The default value is 29,000 milliseconds.

args.name: rest_api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated REST API

args.name: resource_id
args.description: (Required) The API resource ID

args.name: http_method
args.description: (Required) The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY)

args.name: status_code
args.description: (Required) The HTTP status code

args.name: selection_pattern
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the regular expression pattern used to choose
an integration response based on the response from the backend. Setting this to - makes the integration the default one.
If the backend is an AWS Lambda function, the AWS Lambda function error header is matched.
For all other HTTP and AWS backends, the HTTP status code is matched.

args.name: response_templates
args.description: (Optional) A map specifying the templates used to transform the integration response body

args.name: response_parameters
args.description:
(Optional) A map of response parameters that can be read from the backend response.

args.name: unauthorized_cache_control_header_strategy
args.description: (Optional) Specifies how to handle unauthorized requests for cache invalidation. The available values are FAIL_WITH_403, SUCCEED_WITH_RESPONSE_HEADER, SUCCEED_WITHOUT_RESPONSE_HEADER.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the policy.

args.name: policy_type
args.description: (Optional) For DynamoDB, only TargetTrackingScaling is supported. For Amazon ECS, Spot Fleet, and Amazon RDS, both StepScaling and TargetTrackingScaling are supported. For any other service, only StepScaling is supported. Defaults to StepScaling.

args.name: resource_id
args.description: (Required) The resource type and unique identifier string for the resource associated with the scaling policy. Documentation can be found in the ResourceId parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

args.name: scalable_dimension
args.description: (Required) The scalable dimension of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ScalableDimension parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

args.name: service_namespace
args.description: (Required) The AWS service namespace of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ServiceNamespace parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

args.name: step_scaling_policy_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Step scaling policy configuration, requires policy_type = "StepScaling" (default). See supported fields below.

args.name: adjustment_type
args.description: (Required) Specifies whether the adjustment is an absolute number or a percentage of the current capacity. Valid values are ChangeInCapacity, ExactCapacity, and PercentChangeInCapacity.

args.name: cooldown
args.description: (Required) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start.

args.name: metric_aggregation_type
args.description: (Optional) The aggregation type for the policy's metrics. Valid values are "Minimum", "Maximum", and "Average". Without a value, AWS will treat the aggregation type as "Average".

args.name: min_adjustment_magnitude
args.description: (Optional) The minimum number to adjust your scalable dimension as a result of a scaling activity. If the adjustment type is PercentChangeInCapacity, the scaling policy changes the scalable dimension of the scalable target by this amount.

args.name: metric_interval_lower_bound
args.description: (Optional) The lower bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. Without a value, AWS will treat this bound as negative infinity.

args.name: metric_interval_upper_bound
args.description: (Optional) The upper bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. Without a value, AWS will treat this bound as infinity. The upper bound must be greater than the lower bound.

args.name: scaling_adjustment
args.description: (Required) The number of members by which to scale, when the adjustment bounds are breached. A positive value scales up. A negative value scales down.

args.name: step_adjustment
target_tracking_scaling_policy_configuration
args.description: (Optional) A target tracking policy, requires policy_type = "TargetTrackingScaling". See supported fields below.

args.name: target_value
args.description: (Required) The target value for the metric.

args.name: disable_scale_in
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether scale in by the target tracking policy is disabled. If the value is true, scale in is disabled and the target tracking policy won't remove capacity from the scalable resource. Otherwise, scale in is enabled and the target tracking policy can remove capacity from the scalable resource. The default value is false.

args.name: scale_in_cooldown
args.description: (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scale in activity completes before another scale in activity can start.

args.name: scale_out_cooldown
args.description: (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scale out activity completes before another scale out activity can start.

args.description: (Optional) A regular expression for validating the incoming Amazon Cognito User Pool app client ID.

args.name: aws_region
args.description: (Optional) The AWS region in which the user pool was created.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: API ID

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The ARN

attrs.name: uris
attrs.description: Map of URIs associated with the API. e.g. uris["GRAPHQL"] = https://ID.appsync-api.REGION.amazonaws.com/graphql

args.name: api_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the associated AppSync API

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The API key description. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

args.name: expires
args.description: (Optional) RFC3339 string representation of the expiry date. Rounded down to nearest hour. By default, it is 7 days from the date of creation.

attrs.name: id

attrs.name: key
attrs.description: The API key

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the database to create.

args.name: bucket
args.description: (Required) Name of s3 bucket to save the results of the query execution.

args.name: encryption_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The encryption key block AWS Athena uses to decrypt the data in S3, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. An encryption_configuration block is documented below.

args.name: encryption_option
args.description: (Required) The type of key; one of SSE_S3, SSE_KMS, CSE_KMS

args.name: kms_key
args.description: (Optional) The KMS key ARN or ID; required for key types SSE_KMS and CSE_KMS.

args.name: force_destroy
args.description: (Optional, Default: false) A boolean that indicates all tables should be deleted from the database so that the database can be destroyed without error. The tables are not recoverable.

attrs.name: id
