args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the build

args.name: operating_system
args.description: (Required) Operating system that the game server binaries are built to run on. e.g. WINDOWS_2012 or AMAZON_LINUX.

args.name: storage_location
args.description: (Required) Information indicating where your game build files are stored. See below.

args.name: bucket
args.description: (Required) Name of your S3 bucket.

args.name: key
args.description: (Required) Name of the zip file containing your build files.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) ARN of the access role that allows Amazon GameLift to access your S3 bucket.

args.name: version
args.description: (Optional) Version that is associated with this build.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Build ID.

args.name: build_id
args.description: (Required) ID of the Gamelift Build to be deployed on the fleet.

args.name: ec2_instance_type
args.description: (Required) Name of an EC2 instance type. e.g. t2.micro

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the fleet.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description of the fleet.

args.name: ec2_inbound_permission
args.description: (Optional) Range of IP addresses and port settings that permit inbound traffic to access server processes running on the fleet. See below.

args.name: from_port
args.description: (Required) Starting value for a range of allowed port numbers.

args.name: ip_range
args.description: (Required) Range of allowed IP addresses expressed in CIDR notation. e.g. 000.000.000.000/[subnet mask] or 0.0.0.0/[subnet mask].

args.name: protocol
args.description: (Required) Network communication protocol used by the fleet. e.g. TCP or UDP

args.name: to_port
args.description: (Required) Ending value for a range of allowed port numbers. Port numbers are end-inclusive. This value must be higher than from_port.

args.name: metric_groups
args.description: (Optional) List of names of metric groups to add this fleet to. A metric group tracks metrics across all fleets in the group. Defaults to default.

args.name: new_game_session_protection_policy
args.description: (Optional) Game session protection policy to apply to all instances in this fleet. e.g. FullProtection. Defaults to NoProtection.

args.name: resource_creation_limit_policy
args.description: (Optional) Policy that limits the number of game sessions an individual player can create over a span of time for this fleet. See below.

args.name: new_game_sessions_per_creator
args.description: (Optional) Maximum number of game sessions that an individual can create during the policy period.

args.name: policy_period_in_minutes
args.description: (Optional) Time span used in evaluating the resource creation limit policy.

args.name: runtime_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Instructions for launching server processes on each instance in the fleet. See below.

args.name: game_session_activation_timeout_seconds
args.description: (Optional) Maximum amount of time (in seconds) that a game session can remain in status ACTIVATING.

args.name: max_concurrent_game_session_activations
args.description: (Optional) Maximum number of game sessions with status ACTIVATING to allow on an instance simultaneously.

args.name: server_process
args.description: (Optional) Collection of server process configurations that describe which server processes to run on each instance in a fleet. See below.

args.name: concurrent_executions
args.description: (Required) Number of server processes using this configuration to run concurrently on an instance.

args.name: launch_path
args.description: (Required) Location of the server executable in a game build. All game builds are installed on instances at the root : for Windows instances C:\game, and for Linux instances /local/game.

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) Optional list of parameters to pass to the server executable on launch.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Fleet ID.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: Fleet ARN.

attrs.name: operating_system
attrs.description: Operating system of the fleet's computing resources.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the session queue.

args.name: timeout_in_seconds
args.description: (Required) Maximum time a game session request can remain in the queue.

args.name: destinations
args.description: (Optional) List of fleet/alias ARNs used by session queue for placing game sessions.

args.name: player_latency_policy
args.description: (Optional) One or more policies used to choose fleet based on player latency. See below.

args.name: maximum_individual_player_latency_milliseconds
args.description: (Required) Maximum latency value that is allowed for any player.

args.name: policy_duration_seconds
args.description: (Optional) Length of time that the policy is enforced while placing a new game session. Absence of value for this attribute means that the policy is enforced until the queue times out.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: Game Session Queue ARN.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the Vault. Names can be between 1 and 255 characters long and the valid characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (hyphen), and '.' (period).

args.name: access_policy
args.description:
(Optional) The policy document. This is a JSON formatted string.
The heredoc syntax or file function is helpful here. Use the Glacier Developer Guide for more information on Glacier Vault Policy

args.name: notification
args.description: (Optional) The notifications for the Vault. Fields documented below.

args.name: events
args.description: (Required) You can configure a vault to publish a notification for ArchiveRetrievalCompleted and InventoryRetrievalCompleted events.

args.name: sns_topic
args.description: (Required) The SNS Topic ARN.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: location
attrs.description: The URI of the vault that was created.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The ARN of the vault.

args.name: complete_lock
args.description: (Required) Boolean whether to permanently apply this Glacier Lock Policy. Once completed, this cannot be undone. If set to false, the Glacier Lock Policy remains in a testing mode for 24 hours. After that time, the Glacier Lock Policy is automatically removed by Glacier and the Terraform resource will show as needing recreation. Changing this from false to true will show as resource recreation, which is expected. Changing this from true to false is not possible unless the Glacier Vault is recreated at the same time.

args.name: policy
args.description: (Required) JSON string containing the IAM policy to apply as the Glacier Vault Lock policy.

args.name: vault_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the Glacier Vault.

args.name: ignore_deletion_error
args.description: (Optional) Allow Terraform to ignore the error returned when attempting to delete the Glacier Lock Policy. This can be used to delete or recreate the Glacier Vault via Terraform, for example, if the Glacier Vault Lock policy permits that action. This should only be used in conjunction with complete_lock being set to true.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Glacier Vault name.

args.name: name

args.name: ip_address_type
args.description: (Optional) The value for the address type must be IPV4.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or false. The default value is true.

args.name: attributes

args.name: flow_logs_enabled
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether flow logs are enabled.

args.name: flow_logs_s3_bucket
args.description: (Optional) The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.

args.name: flow_logs_s3_prefix
args.description: (Optional) The prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.

attrs.name: id

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the database.

args.name: catalog_id
args.description: (Optional) ID of the Glue Catalog to create the database in. If omitted, this defaults to the AWS Account ID.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Description of the database.

args.name: location_uri
args.description: (Optional) The location of the database (for example, an HDFS path).

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) A list of key-value pairs that define parameters and properties of the database.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the table. For Hive compatibility, this must be entirely lowercase.

args.name: database_name
args.description: (Required) Name of the metadata database where the table metadata resides. For Hive compatibility, this must be all lowercase.

args.name: catalog_id
args.description: (Optional) ID of the Glue Catalog and database to create the table in. If omitted, this defaults to the AWS Account ID plus the database name.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Description of the table.

args.name: owner
args.description: (Optional) Owner of the table.

args.name: retention
args.description: (Optional) Retention time for this table.

args.name: storage_descriptor
args.description: (Optional) A storage descriptor object containing information about the physical storage of this table. You can refer to the Glue Developer Guide for a full explanation of this object.

args.name: columns
args.description: (Optional) A list of the Columns in the table.

args.name: location
args.description: (Optional) The physical location of the table. By default this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

args.name: input_format
args.description: (Optional) The input format: SequenceFileInputFormat (binary), or TextInputFormat, or a custom format.

args.name: output_format
args.description: (Optional) The output format: SequenceFileOutputFormat (binary), or IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat, or a custom format.

args.name: compressed
args.description: (Optional) True if the data in the table is compressed, or False if not.

args.name: number_of_buckets
args.description: (Optional) Must be specified if the table contains any dimension columns.

args.name: ser_de_info
args.description: (Optional) Serialization/deserialization (SerDe) information.

args.name: bucket_columns
args.description: (Optional) A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.

args.name: sort_columns
args.description: (Optional) A list of Order objects specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) User-supplied properties in key-value form.

args.name: skewed_info
args.description: (Optional) Information about values that appear very frequently in a column (skewed values).

args.name: stored_as_sub_directories
args.description: (Optional) True if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or False if not.

args.name: partition_keys
args.description: (Optional) A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

args.name: view_original_text
args.description: (Optional) If the table is a view, the original text of the view; otherwise null.

args.name: view_expanded_text
args.description: (Optional) If the table is a view, the expanded text of the view; otherwise null.

args.name: table_type
args.description: (Optional) The type of this table (EXTERNAL_TABLE, VIRTUAL_VIEW, etc.).

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) Properties associated with this table, as a list of key-value pairs.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the Column.

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) The datatype of data in the Column.

args.name: comment
args.description: (Optional) Free-form text comment.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Name of the SerDe.

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) A map of initialization parameters for the SerDe, in key-value form.

args.name: serialization_library
args.description: (Optional) Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is: org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe.

args.name: column
args.description: (Required) The name of the column.

args.name: sort_order
args.description: (Required) Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order (== 1), or in descending order (==0).

args.name: skewed_column_names
args.description: (Optional) A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.

args.name: skewed_column_value_location_maps
args.description: (Optional) A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.

args.name: skewed_column_values
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.

args.name: custom_patterns

args.name: json_classifier

args.name: json_path
args.description: (Required) A JsonPath string defining the JSON data for the classifier to classify. AWS Glue supports a subset of JsonPath, as described in Writing JsonPath Custom Classifiers.

args.name: name

args.name: xml_classifier
args.description: – (Optional) A classifier for XML content. Defined below.

args.name: classification
args.description: (Required) An identifier of the data format that the classifier matches.

args.name: row_tag
args.description: (Required) The XML tag designating the element that contains each record in an XML document being parsed. Note that this cannot identify a self-closing element (closed by />). An empty row element that contains only attributes can be parsed as long as it ends with a closing tag (for example, <row item_a="A" item_b="B"></row> is okay, but <row item_a="A" item_b="B" /> is not).

For information about how to specify and consume your own Job arguments, see the Calling AWS Glue APIs in Python topic in the developer guide. For information about the key-value pairs that AWS Glue consumes to set up your job, see the Special Parameters Used by AWS Glue topic in the developer guide.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the IAM Role used to send application messages.

args.name: inputs

args.description: (Required) The Name Prefix to use when creating an in-application stream.

(Optional) The Kinesis Stream configuration for the streaming source. Conflicts with kinesis_firehose. 
See Kinesis Stream below for more details.

args.name: parallelism
args.description:
(Optional) The number of Parallel in-application streams to create. 
See Parallelism below for more details.

args.name: processing_configuration
args.description:
(Optional) The Processing Configuration to transform records as they are received from the stream.
See Processing Configuration below for more details.

args.name: outputs
args.description: (Optional) Output destination configuration of the application. See Outputs below for more details.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The Name of the in-application stream.

args.name: schema
args.description: (Required) The Schema format of the data written to the destination. See Destination Schema below for more details.

args.name: kinesis_firehose
args.description:
(Optional) The Kinesis Firehose configuration for the destination stream. Conflicts with kinesis_stream.
See Kinesis Firehose below for more details.

args.name: kinesis_stream
args.description:
(Optional) The Kinesis Stream configuration for the destination stream. Conflicts with kinesis_firehose.
See Kinesis Stream below for more details.

args.name: lambda
args.description: (Optional) The Lambda function destination. See Lambda below for more details.

args.name: reference_data_sources
args.description:
(Optional) An S3 Reference Data Source for the application. 
See Reference Data Sources below for more details.

args.name: schema
args.description: (Required) The Schema format of the data in the streaming source. See Source Schema below for more details.

args.name: table_name
args.description: (Required) The in-application Table Name.

args.name: s3
args.description: (Optional) The S3 configuration for the reference data source. See S3 Reference below for more details.

args.name: resource_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the Kinesis Firehose delivery stream.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the IAM Role used to access the stream.

args.name: resource_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the Kinesis Stream.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the IAM Role used to access the stream.

args.name: record_format_type
args.description: (Required) The Format Type of the records on the output stream. Can be CSV or JSON.

args.name: record_columns
args.description:
(Required) The Record Column mapping for the streaming source data element.
See Record Columns below for more details.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the column.

args.name: sql_type
args.description: (Required) The SQL Type of the column.

args.name: mapping
args.description: (Optional) The Mapping reference to the data element.

args.name: record_format
args.description:
(Required) The Record Format and mapping information to schematize a record.
See Record Format below for more details.

args.name: record_format_type
args.description: (Required) The type of Record Format. Can be CSV or JSON.

args.name: mapping_parameters
args.description:
(Optional) The Mapping Information for the record format.
See Mapping Parameters below for more details.

args.name: record_encoding
args.description: (Optional) The Encoding of the record in the streaming source.

args.name: count
args.description: (Required) The Count of streams.

args.name: lambda
args.description: (Required) The Lambda function configuration. See Lambda below for more details.

args.name: resource_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the Lambda function.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the IAM Role used to access the Lambda function.

args.name: csv
args.description:
(Optional) Mapping information when the record format uses delimiters.
See CSV Mapping Parameters below for more details.

args.name: record_column_delimiter
args.description: (Required) The Column Delimiter.

args.name: record_row_delimiter
args.description: (Required) The Row Delimiter.

args.name: json
args.description:
(Optional) Mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source.
See JSON Mapping Parameters below for more details.

args.name: record_row_path
args.description: (Required) Path to the top-level parent that contains the records.

args.name: bucket_arn
args.description: (Required) The S3 Bucket ARN.

args.name: file_key
args.description: (Required) The File Key name containing reference data.

args.name: role_arn

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The ARN of the Kinesis Analytics Application.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The ARN of the Kinesis Analytics Appliation.

attrs.name: create_timestamp
attrs.description: The Timestamp when the application version was created.

attrs.name: last_update_timestamp
attrs.description: The Timestamp when the application was last updated.

attrs.name: status

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A name to identify the stream. This is unique to the
AWS account and region the Stream is created in.

args.name: shard_count
args.description:
– (Required) The number of shards that the stream will use.
Amazon has guidlines for specifying the Stream size that should be referenced
when creating a Kinesis stream. See Amazon Kinesis Streams for more.

args.name: retention_period
args.description: (Optional) Length of time data records are accessible after they are added to the stream. The maximum value of a stream's retention period is 168 hours. Minimum value is 24. Default is 24.

args.name: shard_level_metrics
args.description: (Optional) A list of shard-level CloudWatch metrics which can be enabled for the stream. See Monitoring with CloudWatch for more. Note that the value ALL should not be used; instead you should provide an explicit list of metrics you wish to enable.

args.name: encryption_type
args.description: (Optional) The encryption type to use. The only acceptable values are NONE or KMS. The default value is NONE.

args.name: kms_key_id
args.description: (Optional) The GUID for the customer-managed KMS key to use for encryption. You can also use a Kinesis-owned master key by specifying the alias aws/kinesis.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique Stream id

attrs.name: name
attrs.description: The unique Stream name

attrs.name: shard_count
attrs.description: The count of Shards for this Stream

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the Stream (same as id)

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A name to identify the stream. This is unique to the
AWS account and region the Stream is created in.

args.name: input_format_configuration
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data from JSON. More details below.

args.name: output_format_configuration
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. More details below.

args.name: schema_configuration
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column information. More details below.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Defaults to true. Set it to false if you want to disable format conversion while preserving the configuration details.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

args.name: kinesis_source_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Allows the ability to specify the kinesis stream that is used as the source of the firehose delivery stream.

args.name: kinesis_stream_arn
args.description: (Required) The kinesis stream used as the source of the firehose delivery stream.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that provides access to the source Kinesis stream.

args.name: destination
args.description: – (Required) This is the destination to where the data is delivered. The only options are s3 (Deprecated, use extended_s3 instead), extended_s3, redshift, elasticsearch, and splunk.

args.name: s3_configuration
args.description:
(Optional, Deprecated, see/use extended_s3_configuration unless destination is redshift) Configuration options for the s3 destination (or the intermediate bucket if the destination
is redshift). More details are given below.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the AWS credentials.

args.name: bucket_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the S3 bucket

args.name: prefix
args.description: (Optional) The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for delivered S3 files. You can specify an extra prefix to be added in front of the time format prefix. Note that if the prefix ends with a slash, it appears as a folder in the S3 bucket

args.name: buffer_size
args.description: (Optional) Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.                          We recommend setting SizeInMBs to a value greater than the amount of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds. For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec set SizeInMBs to be 10 MB or higher.

args.name: buffer_interval
args.description: (Optional) Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300.

args.name: compression_format
args.description: (Optional) The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED. Other supported values are GZIP, ZIP & Snappy. If the destination is redshift you cannot use ZIP or Snappy.

args.name: kms_key_arn
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the KMS key ARN the stream will use to encrypt data. If not set, no encryption will
be used.

args.name: cloudwatch_logging_options
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch Logging Options for the delivery stream. More details are given below

args.name: data_format_conversion_configuration
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument for the serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon S3. More details given below.

args.name: error_output_prefix
args.description: (Optional) Prefix added to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name.

args.name: processing_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The data processing configuration.  More details are given below.

args.name: s3_backup_mode
args.description: (Optional) The Amazon S3 backup mode.  Valid values are Disabled and Enabled.  Default value is Disabled.

args.name: s3_backup_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The configuration for backup in Amazon S3. Required if s3_backup_mode is Enabled. Supports the same fields as s3_configuration object.

args.name: extended_s3_configuration
args.description: (Optional, only Required when destination is extended_s3) Enhanced configuration options for the s3 destination. More details are given below.

args.name: redshift_configuration
args.description:
(Optional) Configuration options if redshift is the destination.
Using redshift_configuration requires the user to also specify a
s3_configuration block. More details are given below.

args.name: cluster_jdbcurl
args.description: (Required) The jdbcurl of the redshift cluster.

args.name: username
args.description: (Required) The username that the firehose delivery stream will assume. It is strongly recommended that the username and password provided is used exclusively for Amazon Kinesis Firehose purposes, and that the permissions for the account are restricted for Amazon Redshift INSERT permissions.

args.name: password
args.description: (Required) The password for the username above.

args.name: retry_duration
args.description: (Optional) The length of time during which Firehose retries delivery after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Firehose does not retry if the value of DurationInSeconds is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery attempt takes longer than the current value.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The arn of the role the stream assumes.

args.name: s3_backup_mode
args.description: (Optional) The Amazon S3 backup mode.  Valid values are Disabled and Enabled.  Default value is Disabled.

args.name: s3_backup_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The configuration for backup in Amazon S3. Required if s3_backup_mode is Enabled. Supports the same fields as s3_configuration object.

args.name: data_table_name
args.description: (Required) The name of the table in the redshift cluster that the s3 bucket will copy to.

args.name: copy_options
args.description: (Optional) Copy options for copying the data from the s3 intermediate bucket into redshift, for example to change the default delimiter. For valid values, see the AWS documentation

args.name: data_table_columns
args.description: (Optional) The data table columns that will be targeted by the copy command.

args.name: cloudwatch_logging_options
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch Logging Options for the delivery stream. More details are given below

args.name: processing_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The data processing configuration.  More details are given below.

args.name: buffering_interval
args.description: (Optional) Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds between 60 to 900, before delivering it to the destination.  The default value is 300s.

args.name: buffering_size
args.description: (Optional) Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs between 1 to 100, before delivering it to the destination.  The default value is 5MB.

args.name: domain_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the Amazon ES domain.  The IAM role must have permission for DescribeElasticsearchDomain, DescribeElasticsearchDomains, and DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig after assuming RoleARN.  The pattern needs to be arn:.*.

args.name: index_name
args.description: (Required) The Elasticsearch index name.

args.name: index_rotation_period
args.description: (Optional) The Elasticsearch index rotation period.  Index rotation appends a timestamp to the IndexName to facilitate expiration of old data.  Valid values are NoRotation, OneHour, OneDay, OneWeek, and OneMonth.  The default value is OneDay.

args.name: retry_duration
args.description: (Optional) After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon Elasticsearch, the total amount of time, in seconds between 0 to 7200, during which Firehose re-attempts delivery (including the first attempt).  After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to Amazon S3.  The default value is 300s.  There will be no retry if the value is 0.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The ARN of the IAM role to be assumed by Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and for indexing documents.  The pattern needs to be arn:.*.

args.name: s3_backup_mode
args.description: (Optional) Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3.  Valid values are FailedDocumentsOnly and AllDocuments.  Default value is FailedDocumentsOnly.

args.name: type_name
args.description: (Required) The Elasticsearch type name with maximum length of 100 characters.

args.name: cloudwatch_logging_options
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch Logging Options for the delivery stream. More details are given below

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Enables or disables the logging. Defaults to false.

args.name: log_group_name
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch group name for logging. This value is required if enabled is true.

args.name: log_stream_name
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch log stream name for logging. This value is required if enabled is true.

args.name: processing_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The data processing configuration.  More details are given below.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Enables or disables data processing.

args.name: processors
args.description: (Optional) Array of data processors. More details are given below

args.name: hec_acknowledgment_timeout
args.description: (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds between 180 and 600, that Kinesis Firehose waits to receive an acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data.

args.name: hec_endpoint
args.description: (Required) The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Firehose sends your data.

args.name: hec_endpoint_type
args.description: (Optional) The HEC endpoint type. Valid values are Raw or Event. The default value is Raw.

args.name: hec_token
args.description: The GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC endpoint.

args.name: s3_backup_mode
args.description: (Optional) Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3.  Valid values are FailedEventsOnly and AllEvents.  Default value is FailedEventsOnly.

args.name: retry_duration
args.description: (Optional) After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon Elasticsearch, the total amount of time, in seconds between 0 to 7200, during which Firehose re-attempts delivery (including the first attempt).  After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to Amazon S3.  The default value is 300s.  There will be no retry if the value is 0.

args.name: cloudwatch_logging_options
args.description: (Optional) The CloudWatch Logging Options for the delivery stream. More details are given below.

args.name: processing_configuration
args.description: (Optional) The data processing configuration.  More details are given below.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The type of processor. Valid Values: Lambda

args.name: parameters
args.description: (Optional) Array of processor parameters. More details are given below

args.name: parameter_name
args.description: (Required) Parameter name. Valid Values: LambdaArn, NumberOfRetries, RoleArn, BufferSizeInMBs, BufferIntervalInSeconds

args.name: parameter_value
args.description: (Required) Parameter value. Must be between 1 and 512 length (inclusive). When providing a Lambda ARN, you should specify the resource version as well.

args.name: deserializer
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. More details below.

args.name: hive_json_ser_de
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument that specifies the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. More details below.

args.name: open_x_json_ser_de
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument that specifies the OpenX SerDe. More details below.

args.name: timestamp_formats
args.description: (Optional) A list of how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to parse the date and time stamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see Class DateTimeFormat. You can also use the special value millis to parse time stamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a format, Kinesis Data Firehose uses java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf by default.

args.name: case_insensitive
args.description: (Optional) When set to true, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.

args.name: column_to_json_key_mappings
args.description: (Optional) A map of column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords. For example, timestamp is a Hive keyword. If you have a JSON key named timestamp, set this parameter to { ts = "timestamp" } to map this key to a column named ts.

args.name: convert_dots_in_json_keys_to_underscores
args.description: (Optional) When set to true, specifies that the names of the keys include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose name is "a.b", you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using this option. Defaults to false.

args.name: serializer
args.description: (Required) Nested argument that specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe or the Parquet SerDe. More details below.

args.name: orc_ser_de
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument that specifies converting data to the ORC format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache ORC. More details below.

args.name: parquet_ser_de
args.description: (Optional) Nested argument that specifies converting data to the Parquet format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache Parquet. More details below.

args.name: block_size_bytes
args.description: (Optional) The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

args.name: bloom_filter_columns
args.description: (Optional) A list of column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create bloom filters.

args.name: bloom_filter_false_positive_probability
args.description: (Optional) The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP, the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is 0, and the maximum is 1.

args.name: compression
args.description: (Optional) The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is SNAPPY.

args.name: dictionary_key_threshold
args.description: (Optional) A float that represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.

args.name: enable_padding
args.description: (Optional) Set this to true to indicate that you want stripes to be padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is false.

args.name: format_version
args.description: (Optional) The version of the file to write. The possible values are V0_11 and V0_12. The default is V0_12.

args.name: padding_tolerance
args.description: (Optional) A float between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which means 5 percent of stripe size. For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks, the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of 3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a node-local task. Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when enable_padding is false.

args.name: row_index_stride
args.description: (Optional) The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10000 and the minimum is 1000.

args.name: stripe_size_bytes
args.description: (Optional) The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the minimum is 8 MiB.

args.name: block_size_bytes
args.description: (Optional) The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

args.name: compression
args.description: (Optional) The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are UNCOMPRESSED, SNAPPY, and GZIP, with the default being SNAPPY. Use SNAPPY for higher decompression speed. Use GZIP if the compression ratio is more important than speed.

args.name: enable_dictionary_compression
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.

args.name: max_padding_bytes
args.description: (Optional) The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 0.

args.name: page_size_bytes
args.description: (Optional) The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.

args.name: writer_version
args.description: (Optional) Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are V1 and V2. The default is V1.

args.name: database_name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema for the output data.

args.name: role_arn
args.description: (Required) The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose. Cross-account roles aren't allowed.

args.name: table_name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that constitutes your data schema.

args.name: catalog_id
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS account ID is used by default.

args.name: region
args.description: (Optional) If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current region.

args.name: version_id
args.description: (Optional) Specifies the table version for the output data schema. Defaults to LATEST.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the Stream

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The display name of the alias. The name must start with the word "alias" followed by a forward slash (alias/)

args.name: name_prefix
args.description:
(Optional) Creates an unique alias beginning with the specified prefix.
The name must start with the word "alias" followed by a forward slash (alias/).  Conflicts with name.

args.name: target_key_id
args.description: (Required) Identifier for the key for which the alias is for, can be either an ARN or key_id.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key alias.

attrs.name: target_key_arn
attrs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target key identifier.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resources) A friendly name for identifying the grant.

args.name: key_id
args.description: (Required, Forces new resources) The unique identifier for the customer master key (CMK) that the grant applies to. Specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. To specify a CMK in a different AWS account, you must use the key ARN.

args.name: grantee_principal
args.description: (Required, Forces new resources) The principal that is given permission to perform the operations that the grant permits in ARN format. Note that due to eventual consistency issues around IAM principals, terraform's state may not always be refreshed to reflect what is true in AWS.

args.name: operations
args.description: (Required, Forces new resources) A list of operations that the grant permits. The permitted values are: Decrypt, Encrypt, GenerateDataKey, GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext, ReEncryptFrom, ReEncryptTo, CreateGrant, RetireGrant, DescribeKey

args.name: retiree_principal
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resources) The principal that is given permission to retire the grant by using RetireGrant operation in ARN format. Note that due to eventual consistency issues around IAM principals, terraform's state may not always be refreshed to reflect what is true in AWS.

args.name: constraints
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resources) A structure that you can use to allow certain operations in the grant only when the desired encryption context is present. For more information about encryption context, see Encryption Context.

args.name: encryption_context_equals
args.description: (Optional) A list of key-value pairs that must match the encryption context in subsequent cryptographic operation requests. The grant allows the operation only when the encryption context in the request is the same as the encryption context specified in this constraint. Conflicts with encryption_context_subset.

args.name: encryption_context_subset
args.description: (Optional) A list of key-value pairs that must be included in the encryption context of subsequent cryptographic operation requests. The grant allows the cryptographic operation only when the encryption context in the request includes the key-value pairs specified in this constraint, although it can include additional key-value pairs. Conflicts with encryption_context_equals.

args.name: grant_creation_tokens
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resources) A list of grant tokens to be used when creating the grant. See Grant Tokens for more information about grant tokens.

args.name: retire_on_delete
args.description:
(Defaults to false, Forces new resources) If set to false (the default) the grants will be revoked upon deletion, and if set to true the grants will try to be retired upon deletion. Note that retiring grants requires special permissions, hence why we default to revoking grants.
See RetireGrant for more information.

attrs.name: grant_id
attrs.description: The unique identifier for the grant.

attrs.name: grant_token
attrs.description: The grant token for the created grant. For more information, see Grant Tokens.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the key as viewed in AWS console.

args.name: key_usage
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies the intended use of the key.
  Defaults to ENCRYPT_DECRYPT, and only symmetric encryption and decryption are supported.

args.name: policy

args.description: (Required) Lambda function version for which you are creating the alias. Pattern: (\$LATEST|[0-9]+).

attrs.name: invoke_arn
attrs.description: The ARN to be used for invoking Lambda Function from API Gateway - to be used in aws_api_gateway_integration's uri

args.name: batch_size
args.description: (Optional) The largest number of records that Lambda will retrieve from your event source at the time of invocation. Defaults to 100 for DynamoDB and Kinesis, 10 for SQS.

args.name: event_source_arn
args.description: (Required) The event source ARN - can either be a Kinesis or DynamoDB stream.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) Determines if the mapping will be enabled on creation. Defaults to true.

args.name: function_name
args.description: (Required) The name or the ARN of the Lambda function that will be subscribing to events.

args.name: starting_position
args.description: (Optional) The position in the stream where AWS Lambda should start reading. Must be one of AT_TIMESTAMP (Kinesis only), LATEST or TRIM_HORIZON if getting events from Kinesis or DynamoDB. Must not be provided if getting events from SQS. More information about these positions can be found in the AWS DynamoDB Streams API Reference and AWS Kinesis API Reference.

args.name: starting_position_timestamp
args.description: (Optional) A timestamp in RFC3339 format of the data record which to start reading when using starting_position set to AT_TIMESTAMP. If a record with this exact timestamp does not exist, the next later record is chosen. If the timestamp is older than the current trim horizon, the oldest available record is chosen.

attrs.name: function_arn
attrs.description: The the ARN of the Lambda function the event source mapping is sending events to. (Note: this is a computed value that differs from function_name above.)

attrs.description: The date this resource was last modified.

attrs.name: last_processing_result
attrs.description: The result of the last AWS Lambda invocation of your Lambda function.

attrs.name: state
attrs.description: The state of the event source mapping.

attrs.name: state_transition_reason
attrs.description: The reason the event source mapping is in its current state.

attrs.name: uuid
attrs.description: The UUID of the created event source mapping.

args.name: filename
args.description: (Optional) The path to the function's deployment package within the local filesystem. If defined, The s3_-prefixed options cannot be used.

args.name: s3_bucket
args.description: (Optional) The S3 bucket location containing the function's deployment package. Conflicts with filename. This bucket must reside in the same AWS region where you are creating the Lambda function.

args.name: s3_key
args.description: (Optional) The S3 key of an object containing the function's deployment package. Conflicts with filename.

args.name: s3_object_version
args.description: (Optional) The object version containing the function's deployment package. Conflicts with filename.

args.name: function_name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for your Lambda Function.

args.description: (Optional) Nested block to configure the function's dead letter queue. See details below.

args.name: target_arn
args.description:
(Required) The ARN of an SNS topic or SQS queue to notify when an invocation fails. If this
option is used, the function's IAM role must be granted suitable access to write to the target object,
which means allowing either the sns:Publish or sqs:SendMessage action on this ARN, depending on
which service is targeted.

args.name: handler
args.description: (Required) The function entrypoint in your code.

args.name: role
args.description: (Required) IAM role attached to the Lambda Function. This governs both who / what can invoke your Lambda Function, as well as what resources our Lambda Function has access to. See Lambda Permission Model for more details.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Description of what your Lambda Function does.

args.name: layers
args.description: (Optional) List of Lambda Layer Version ARNs (maximum of 5) to attach to your Lambda Function. See Lambda Layers

args.name: memory_size
args.description: (Optional) Amount of memory in MB your Lambda Function can use at runtime. Defaults to 128. See Limits

args.name: runtime
args.description: (Required) See Runtimes for valid values.

args.name: timeout
args.description: (Optional) The amount of time your Lambda Function has to run in seconds. Defaults to 3. See Limits

args.name: reserved_concurrent_executions
args.description: (Optional) The amount of reserved concurrent executions for this lambda function. Defaults to Unreserved Concurrency Limits. See Managing Concurrency

args.name: publish
args.description: (Optional) Whether to publish creation/change as new Lambda Function Version. Defaults to false.

args.name: vpc_config
args.description: (Optional) Provide this to allow your function to access your VPC. Fields documented below. See Lambda in VPC

args.name: subnet_ids
args.description: (Required) A list of subnet IDs associated with the Lambda function.

args.name: security_group_ids
args.description: (Required) A list of security group IDs associated with the Lambda function.

args.name: environment
args.description: (Optional) The Lambda environment's configuration settings. Fields documented below.

args.name: variables
args.description: (Optional) A map that defines environment variables for the Lambda function.

args.name: kms_key_arn
args.description: (Optional) The ARN for the KMS encryption key.

args.name: source_code_hash
args.description: (Optional) Used to trigger updates. Must be set to a base64-encoded SHA256 hash of the package file specified with either filename or s3_key. The usual way to set this is ${base64sha256(file("file.zip"))}, where "file.zip" is the local filename of the lambda function source archive.

args.name: mode
args.description:
(Required) Can be either PassThrough or Active. If PassThrough, Lambda will only trace
the request from an upstream service if it contains a tracing header with
"sampled=1". If Active, Lambda will respect any tracing header it receives
from an upstream service. If no tracing header is received, Lambda will call
X-Ray for a tracing decision.

Valid values are NONE and FULL. Defaults to NONE indicating that Macie only classifies objects that are added after the association was created.

instances.0.ip_address - The IP Address of the broker.
instances.0.endpoints - The broker's wire-level protocol endpoints in the following order & format referenceable e.g. as instances.0.endpoints.0 (SSL):
ssl://broker-id.mq.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:61617
amqp+ssl://broker-id.mq.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:5671
stomp+ssl://broker-id.mq.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:61614
mqtt+ssl://broker-id.mq.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:8883
wss://broker-id.mq.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:61619

args.name: instance_type
args.description: (Required) The type of instance to start

args.name: stack_id
args.description: (Required) The id of the stack the instance will belong to.

args.name: layer_ids
args.description: (Required) The ids of the layers the instance will belong to.

args.name: state
args.description: (Optional) The desired state of the instance.  Can be either "running" or "stopped".

args.name: install_updates_on_boot
args.description: (Optional) Controls where to install OS and package updates when the instance boots.  Defaults to true.

args.name: auto_scaling_type
args.description: (Optional) Creates load-based or time-based instances.  If set, can be either: "load" or "timer".

args.name: availability_zone
args.description:
(Optional) Name of the availability zone where instances will be created
by default.

args.name: ebs_optimized
args.description: (Optional) If true, the launched EC2 instance will be EBS-optimized.

args.name: hostname
args.description: (Optional) The instance's host name.

args.name: architecture
args.description: (Optional) Machine architecture for created instances.  Can be either "x86_64" (the default) or "i386"

args.name: ami_id
args.description: (Optional) The AMI to use for the instance.  If an AMI is specified, os must be "Custom".

args.name: os
args.description: (Optional) Name of operating system that will be installed.

args.name: root_device_type
args.description: (Optional) Name of the type of root device instances will have by default.  Can be either "ebs" or "instance-store"

args.name: ssh_key_name
args.description: (Optional) Name of the SSH keypair that instances will have by default.

args.name: agent_version
args.description: (Optional) The AWS OpsWorks agent to install.  Defaults to "INHERIT".

args.name: subnet_id
args.description: (Optional) Subnet ID to attach to

args.name: tenancy
args.description: (Optional) Instance tenancy to use. Can be one of "default", "dedicated" or "host"

args.name: virtualization_type
args.description:
(Optional) Keyword to choose what virtualization mode created instances
will use. Can be either "paravirtual" or "hvm".

args.name: root_block_device
args.description:
(Optional) Customize details about the root block
device of the instance. See Block Devices below for details.

args.name: volume_type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of volume. Can be "standard", "gp2",
or "io1". (Default: "standard").

args.name: volume_size
args.description: (Optional) The size of the volume in gigabytes.

args.name: iops
args.description:
(Optional) The amount of provisioned
IOPS.
This must be set with a volume_type of "io1".

args.name: delete_on_termination
args.description:
(Optional) Whether the volume should be destroyed
on instance termination (Default: true).

args.name: ebs_block_device
args.description:
(Optional) Additional EBS block devices to attach to the
instance.  See Block Devices below for details.

args.name: device_name
args.description: The name of the device to mount.

args.name: snapshot_id
args.description: (Optional) The Snapshot ID to mount.

args.name: volume_type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of volume. Can be "standard", "gp2",
or "io1". (Default: "standard").

args.name: volume_size
args.description: (Optional) The size of the volume in gigabytes.

args.name: iops
args.description:
(Optional) The amount of provisioned
IOPS.
This must be set with a volume_type of "io1".

args.name: delete_on_termination
args.description:
(Optional) Whether the volume should be destroyed
on instance termination (Default: true).

args.name: ephemeral_block_device
args.description:
(Optional) Customize Ephemeral (also known as
"Instance Store") volumes on the instance. See Block Devices below for details.

args.name: device_name
args.description: The name of the block device to mount on the instance.

args.name: virtual_name
args.description:
The Instance Store Device
Name
(e.g. "ephemeral0")

args.description: (Optional) Lambda function name or ARN to be called for delivery. Conflicts with web_url

args.description: (Required if lambda_function_name or web_url are provided) What mode Lambda should be invoked in. Valid values for this parameter are DELIVERY, FILTER.

args.description: (Optional) Web URL to call for hook. If the URL has authentication specified it will be added as authentication to the request. Conflicts with lambda_function_name

args.name: limits
args.description: (Optional) The default campaign limits for the app. These limits apply to each campaign for the app, unless the campaign overrides the default with limits of its own

args.name: daily
args.description: (Optional) The maximum number of messages that the campaign can send daily.

args.name: maximum_duration
args.description: (Optional) The length of time (in seconds) that the campaign can run before it ends and message deliveries stop. This duration begins at the scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60.

args.name: messages_per_second
args.description: (Optional) The number of messages that the campaign can send per second. The minimum value is 50, and the maximum is 20000.

args.name: total
args.description: (Optional) The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send.

args.name: quiet_time
args.description: (Optional) The default quiet time for the app. Each campaign for this app sends no messages during this time unless the campaign overrides the default with a quiet time of its own

args.name: end
args.description: (Optional) The default end time for quiet time in ISO 8601 format. Required if start is set

args.name: start
args.description: (Optional) The default start time for quiet time in ISO 8601 format. Required if end is set

args.description: (Optional) A list of identifiers of the event sources for which events will be returned. If not specified, then all sources are included in the response. If specified, a source_type must also be specified.

args.name: source_type
args.description: (Optional) The type of source that will be generating the events. Valid options are db-instance, db-security-group, db-parameter-group, db-snapshot, db-cluster or db-cluster-snapshot. If not set, all sources will be subscribed to.

args.name: event_categories
args.description: (Optional) A list of event categories for a SourceType that you want to subscribe to. See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_Events.html or run aws rds describe-event-categories.

args.name: enabled
args.description: (Optional) A boolean flag to enable/disable the subscription. Defaults to true.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

args.name: id
args.description: The name of the RDS event notification subscription

args.name: create
args.description: (Default 40m) How long to wait for a RDS event notification subscription to be ready.

args.name: delete
args.description: (Default 40m) How long to wait for a RDS event notification subscription to be deleted.

args.name: update
args.description: (Default 40m) How long to wait for a RDS event notification subscription to be updated.

args.name: arn
args.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the RDS event notification subscription

args.name: customer_aws_id

args.description:
(Required unless a snapshot_identifier or
replicate_source_db is provided) The allocated storage in gibibytes.

args.name: allow_major_version_upgrade
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates that major version
upgrades are allowed. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage and
the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

args.name: apply_immediately
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether any database modifications
are applied immediately, or during the next maintenance window. Default is
false. See Amazon RDS Documentation for more
information.
for more information.

args.name: auto_minor_version_upgrade
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates that minor engine upgrades
will be applied automatically to the DB instance during the maintenance window.
Defaults to true.

args.name: availability_zone
args.description: (Optional) The AZ for the RDS instance.

args.name: backup_retention_period
args.description:
(Optional) The days to retain backups for. Must be
between 0 and 35. When creating a Read Replica the value must be greater than 0. See Read Replica.

args.name: backup_window
args.description:
(Optional) The daily time range (in UTC) during which
automated backups are created if they are enabled. Example: "09:46-10:16". Must
not overlap with maintenance_window.

args.name: character_set_name
args.description:
(Optional) The character set name to use for DB
encoding in Oracle instances. This can't be changed. See Oracle Character Sets
Supported in Amazon
RDS
for more information.

args.description: – (Optional, boolean) Copy all Instance tags to snapshots. Default is false.

args.description:
(Optional) Name of DB subnet group. DB instance will
be created in the VPC associated with the DB subnet group. If unspecified, will
be created in the default VPC, or in EC2 Classic, if available. When working
with read replicas, it needs to be specified only if the source database
specifies an instance in another AWS Region. See DBSubnetGroupName in API
action CreateDBInstanceReadReplica
for additional read replica contraints.

args.name: deletion_protection
args.description: (Optional) If the DB instance should have deletion protection enabled. The database can't be deleted when this value is set to true. The default is false.

args.name: domain
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the Directory Service Active Directory domain to create the instance in.

args.name: domain_iam_role_name
args.description: (Optional, but required if domain is provided) The name of the IAM role to be used when making API calls to the Directory Service.

args.name: enabled_cloudwatch_logs_exports
args.description: (Optional) List of log types to enable for exporting to CloudWatch logs. If omitted, no logs will be exported. Valid values (depending on engine): alert, audit, error, general, listener, slowquery, trace, postgresql (PostgreSQL), upgrade (PostgreSQL).

args.name: engine
args.description:
(Required unless a snapshot_identifier or replicate_source_db
is provided) The database engine to use.  For supported values, see the Engine parameter in API action CreateDBInstance.
Note that for Amazon Aurora instances the engine must match the DB cluster's engine'.
For information on the difference between the available Aurora MySQL engines
see Comparison between Aurora MySQL 1 and Aurora MySQL 2
in the Amazon RDS User Guide.

args.name: bucket_name
args.description: (Required) The bucket name where your backup is stored

args.name: bucket_prefix
args.description: (Optional) Can be blank, but is the path to your backup

args.name: ingestion_role
args.description: (Required) Role applied to load the data.

args.name: source_engine
args.description: (Required, as of Feb 2018 only 'mysql' supported) Source engine for the backup

args.name: source_engine_version
args.description: (Required, as of Feb 2018 only '5.6' supported) Version of the source engine used to make the backup

args.name: engine_version
args.description:
(Optional) The engine version to use. If auto_minor_version_upgrade
is enabled, you can provide a prefix of the version such as 5.7 (for 5.7.10) and
this attribute will ignore differences in the patch version automatically (e.g. 5.7.17).
For supported values, see the EngineVersion parameter in API action CreateDBInstance.
Note that for Amazon Aurora instances the engine version must match the DB cluster's engine version'.

args.name: final_snapshot_identifier
args.description:
(Optional) The name of your final DB snapshot
when this DB instance is deleted. If omitted, no final snapshot will be made.

args.name: iam_database_authentication_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether or
mappings of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database
accounts is enabled.

args.name: identifier
args.description:
(Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the RDS instance,
if omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique identifier.

args.name: identifier_prefix
args.description:
(Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique
identifier beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with identifier.

args.name: instance_class
args.description: (Required) The instance type of the RDS instance.

args.name: iops
args.description:
(Optional) The amount of provisioned IOPS. Setting this implies a
storage_type of "io1".

args.name: kms_key_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ARN for the KMS encryption key. If creating an
encrypted replica, set this to the destination KMS ARN.

args.name: license_model
args.description:
(Optional, but required for some DB engines, i.e. Oracle
SE1) License model information for this DB instance.

args.name: maintenance_window
args.description:
(Optional) The window to perform maintenance in.
Syntax: "ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi". Eg: "Mon:00:00-Mon:03:00". See RDS
Maintenance Window
docs
for more information.

args.name: monitoring_interval
args.description:
(Optional) The interval, in seconds, between points
when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance. To disable
collecting Enhanced Monitoring metrics, specify 0. The default is 0. Valid
Values: 0, 1, 5, 10, 15, 30, 60.

args.name: monitoring_role_arn
args.description:
(Optional) The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS
to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs. You can find more
information on the AWS
Documentation
what IAM permissions are needed to allow Enhanced Monitoring for RDS Instances.

args.name: multi_az
args.description: (Optional) Specifies if the RDS instance is multi-AZ

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the database to create when the DB instance is created. If this parameter is not specified, no database is created in the DB instance. Note that this does not apply for Oracle or SQL Server engines. See the AWS documentation for more details on what applies for those engines.

args.name: option_group_name
args.description: (Optional) Name of the DB option group to associate.

args.name: parameter_group_name
args.description:
(Optional) Name of the DB parameter group to
associate.

args.name: password
args.description:
(Required unless a snapshot_identifier or replicate_source_db
is provided) Password for the master DB user. Note that this may show up in
logs, and it will be stored in the state file.

args.name: port
args.description: (Optional) The port on which the DB accepts connections.

args.name: publicly_accessible
args.description:
(Optional) Bool to control if instance is publicly
accessible. Default is false.

args.name: replicate_source_db
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies that this resource is a Replicate
database, and to use this value as the source database. This correlates to the
identifier of another Amazon RDS Database to replicate. Note that if you are
creating a cross-region replica of an encrypted database you will also need to
specify a kms_key_id. See DB Instance Replication and Working with
PostgreSQL and MySQL Read Replicas
for more information on using Replication.

args.name: security_group_names
args.description:
(Optional/Deprecated) List of DB Security Groups to
associate. Only used for DB Instances on the EC2-Classic
Platform.

args.name: skip_final_snapshot
args.description:
(Optional) Determines whether a final DB snapshot is
created before the DB instance is deleted. If true is specified, no DBSnapshot
is created. If false is specified, a DB snapshot is created before the DB
instance is deleted, using the value from final_snapshot_identifier. Default
is false.

args.name: snapshot_identifier
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether or not to create this
database from a snapshot. This correlates to the snapshot ID you'd find in the
RDS console, e.g: rds:production-2015-06-26-06-05.

args.name: storage_encrypted
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether the DB instance is
encrypted. Note that if you are creating a cross-region read replica this field
is ignored and you should instead declare kms_key_id with a valid ARN. The
default is false if not specified.

args.name: storage_type
args.description:
(Optional) One of "standard" (magnetic), "gp2" (general
purpose SSD), or "io1" (provisioned IOPS SSD). The default is "io1" if iops is
specified, "standard" if not. Note that this behaviour is different from the AWS
web console, where the default is "gp2".

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

args.name: timezone
args.description:
(Optional) Time zone of the DB instance. timezone is currently
only supported by Microsoft SQL Server. The timezone can only be set on
creation. See MSSQL User
Guide
for more information.

args.name: username
args.description:
(Required unless a snapshot_identifier or replicate_source_db
is provided) Username for the master DB user.

args.name: vpc_security_group_ids
args.description:
(Optional) List of VPC security groups to
associate.

args.name: s3_import
args.description: (Optional) Restore from a Percona Xtrabackup in S3.  See Importing Data into an Amazon RDS MySQL DB Instance

args.name: create
args.description:
(Default 40 minutes) Used for Creating Instances, Replicas, and
restoring from Snapshots.

args.name: update
args.description: (Default 80 minutes) Used for Database modifications.

args.name: delete
args.description:
(Default 40 minutes) Used for destroying databases. This includes
the time required to take snapshots.

attrs.name: address
attrs.description: The hostname of the RDS instance. See also endpoint and port.

attrs.name: arn
attrs.description: The ARN of the RDS instance.

attrs.name: allocated_storage
attrs.description: The amount of allocated storage.

attrs.name: availability_zone
attrs.description: The availability zone of the instance.

attrs.name: backup_retention_period
attrs.description: The backup retention period.

attrs.name: backup_window
attrs.description: The backup window.

attrs.name: ca_cert_identifier
attrs.description:
Specifies the identifier of the CA certificate for the
DB instance.

attrs.name: domain
attrs.description: The ID of the Directory Service Active Directory domain the instance is joined to

attrs.name: domain_iam_role_name
attrs.description: The name of the IAM role to be used when making API calls to the Directory Service.

attrs.name: endpoint
attrs.description: The connection endpoint in address:port format.

attrs.name: engine
attrs.description: The database engine.

attrs.name: engine_version
attrs.description: The database engine version.

attrs.name: hosted_zone_id
attrs.description:
The canonical hosted zone ID of the DB instance (to be used
in a Route 53 Alias record).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The RDS instance ID.

attrs.name: instance_class
attrs.description: The RDS instance class.

attrs.name: maintenance_window
attrs.description: The instance maintenance window.

attrs.name: multi_az
attrs.description: If the RDS instance is multi AZ enabled.

attrs.name: name
attrs.description: The database name.

attrs.name: port
attrs.description: The database port.

attrs.name: resource_id
attrs.description: The RDS Resource ID of this instance.

attrs.name: status
attrs.description: The RDS instance status.

attrs.name: storage_encrypted
attrs.description: Specifies whether the DB instance is encrypted.

attrs.name: username
attrs.description: The master username for the database.

args.description: (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the option group. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name. Must be lowercase, to match as it is stored in AWS.

args.name: name_prefix

args.name: option_group_description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the option group. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

args.name: engine_name
args.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the engine that this option group should be associated with.

args.name: major_engine_version

args.name: option
args.description: (Optional) A list of Options to apply.

args.description: (Optional) The Port number when connecting to the Option (e.g. 11211).

args.name: version
args.description: (Optional) The version of the option (e.g. 13.1.0.0).

args.name: db_security_group_memberships
args.description: (Optional) A list of DB Security Groups for which the option is enabled.

args.name: vpc_security_group_memberships

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the DB subnet group. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.

args.name: name_prefix
args.description: (Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with name.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) The description of the DB subnet group. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

args.name: subnet_ids
args.description: (Required) A list of VPC subnet IDs.
